West Virginia University men are putting down their razors and channeling their inner mountain men for almost a month as part of the BeardGrowing Competition PERIOD

Male students participated in the first part of the event Oct PERIOD  a tradition at WVU that unofficially kicks off Mountaineer Week said Sonja Wilson Mountaineer Week adviser PERIOD

This years event was hosted by Mountaineer Mascot Brock Burwell and former mascot Rebecca Durst student chairperson for the beardgrowing committee PERIOD

The event has participants shave off their beards and not shave again until Mountaineer Week when they will be judged on the fullness of their beard PERIOD

Spenser Darden a junior sports and exercise psychology major participated in the BeardGrowing Competition for the first time PERIOD

Darden a resident assistant at Boreman Hall joined the competition with other resident assistants at Boreman PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

The BeardGrowing Competition is sponsored by the University MedExpress Urgent Care and The Ridge apartments Wilson said PERIOD

MedExpress was responsible for donating the cash prizes for the competition she said PERIOD

The five contestants with the thickest beards are placed into the finals and the top three selected will be awarded with a plaque and prizes of  for first  for second and  for third Wilson said PERIOD

The WVU Barnes  Noble Bookstore also gave away aftershave gel for those who signed up and other University organizations helped said Michelle Goodliff student chairperson for Mountaineer Week PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

The BeardGrowing Competition became a regular event in  after Wilson found pamphlets from previous Mountaineer Weeks in the 1970s that included the tradition PERIOD

 Wilson said PERIOD 

The participants will have their beards judged Nov PERIOD  PERIOD

 Goodliff said PERIOD 

There are no strict guidelines on how to win the competition or how the beards are judged said Erin Blake special events coordinator in the Mountainlair who has previously served as a judge PERIOD

 she said PERIOD
